text:
Hello everyone and good morning, Quick question, is there any way to have a public URL for some files i need to call out of HubSpot? For example i have a web <http://xxx.example.com|xxx.example.com> and in my hubspiot directory i have a js file i need to serve to that web so what i am asking is if i could put in the <head> of the external web a <script src="*HubSpot-directory/folder/file.js*"></sccript>

Thank you
Hi, I'm new here, can anyone tell me how to configure client-side ( javascript ) for public app

Hi everyone, I just joined, can you help me
Our marketing department has set up sending emails via HubSpot, we send them via API `<https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/transactional/single-email/send?hapikey=><https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/transactional/single-email/send?hapikey=`|`>;. But they couldn't set up the same emails to be sent from the same app, for development (which will not collect analytics) and for production (which will collect analytics), instead they set up 2 applications and duplicate emails. Is that really how it works?

good morning. not sure if this is theme specific or not, but getting this weird error in Firefox around <http://HubSpotpreview-na1.com|HubSpotpreview-na1.com>. Reinstalled Firefox and all plugins and this is still happening. anyone else seeing this?
Looks like a HubSpot/Browser thing vs. anything related to the theme.  Note, I've found HubSpot works FAR BEST in the chrome browser.
yeah i am seeing that now. thank you. chrome seems to be fine
eesh sorry Dheer, the rss feed in the email template is a different animal. Haven’t played with that in a while and don’t really have time to in the next few days
The HubSpot API docs should help you out
Can you get a little more specific? This is a little to vague to answer
I can confirm. We had a client who used FireFox and she HATED HubSpot. After months of misery I finally suggested she switch to Chrome and then she loved HubSpot
This would be a good question in the <#C2YHAHB6K|api> channel <@U02US2BCHN1>
